p: Wildland fire is one of the major disturbance factors in Mediterranean ecosystems [ 7] and shrub clearings, together with other actions, have been shown to be an effective method to control fires and improve the land management of abandoned areas [ 14]. In this sense, and considering that Cistus ladanifer is a fire-prone plant species [ 6, 7], clearings in areas where this plant is dominant and form dense and continuous shrubs could prevent fires and generate substantial amounts of sustainable raw material to obtain high added value products and bioenergy within the biorefinery concept.
